title: I'd like to see Riot do something like this in order to "improve" player behaviour

embed.description: Blizzard snuck a hilarious gag into the patch that hit the Overwatch public test realm today. The change automatically edits the text chat of anyone who types a certain phase into the match channel-don't worry, you'll only be affected if you're a jerk.

body: Just saw this article and thought that's a pretty good (and hilarious) idea. Perhaps Riot could implement something similar? I don't know if it would be a completely viable option but at least it would be entertaining! XD

replies.body: Riot only care about $$$$$$$ they haven't given 1 shi t about the community since season 1

League is suppose to chat restrict players who type this.

but we all know that's a load of bullshit.

A player would hardly get chat restricted just for typing "gg ez" once or twice, that would be a little over the top don't you think? If they are negative through other means then certainly it would contribute to a punishment, but would very unlikely be worthy of one itself. Maybe if that player had a long history of negativity.
And why not?, its unsportsmanlike and can enforce a change in behaviour long before more serious comments are made.
so are you saying i should be banned for saying good game to an ezreal? :/
It would be awesome if there were easter eggs included as part of this system. I mean, the internet would actually implode if someone were to find one ; )

I would love this tbh (tho I'd wait to see if it makes it to live/works out for OW first :P ), and maybe less "It's past my bedtime. Please don't tell my mommy." and more "For glory and honor! Huzzah comrades!".

I think it's a fun little way to take a bit of that inflamation out of games. Even if you know what they really typed, it's enough for a little giggle or at least the satisfaction of "hah! no gg ez for you!"
Agreed aha. Leave out the childish ones and could have things like "I was outplayed. Good Game". or "A worthy opponent, and a tough game!" aha

Ye :) I certainly think some of them are a little too inflammatory, and if something like it does make it's way onto live I imagine (or hope at least, Blizz obvs has a diff approach to this kind of toxicity than Riot does) most of the more - as you say - childish ones won't be included :P
Sick meme which won't affect anything.
